pros: Great place to work with in the non-profit setting. Christian environment with end goal to help spread the gospel. Insurance premiums are fully paid.
cons: High deductible health plan. Insurance premiums are paid but not necessarily the best insurance.

pros: The people, mission and vision of the organization.
cons: Unfortunately pay and health insurance benefits are not the best but they do provide generous paid time off.

pros: Flexible, Christ-centered, Bible-based, International Teams!
cons: Health Insurance is expensive and comes out of the support you have to raise yourself.

job_title: Technical Office Manager in Cairo, Cairo Governorate
pros: it is a good and family company
cons: this company is excellent at construction

review_title: Ok for some, but not most
pros: Lots of flexibility, good community
cons: Not a lot of support, support-raising required

pros: Flexible and focuses on working as a Team
cons: This is a support raised position and the company takes 12% for operational purposes.

pros: The people are kind and caring. The culture is one of prayer which empowers everyone.
cons: The organization struggles with some benefits packages and diversity, both in lower levels and leadership.

pros: I have been with Pioneers for over 10 years and it has been a deep breath of fresh air. I have worked in ministry for over 25 years and industry for 10. There is an abundance of talk regarding  a relational work environment and how ministries and industry desire to empower members and workers to experiment and create new ideas and pathways. I have found much of that talk to be relatively hollow when tested in my previous ministry and business dealings. Not so my experience with Pioneers. Ministry relationships and interactions have their own set of unique challenges and difficulties. Even with those challenges I have found the leadership, staff, & field workers striving to honor Pioneers core values, vision, and mission with integrity and passion.
cons: No organization, church, or business is the perfect working environment. When you have a less "top down leadership" ministry style and are given levels of freedom within a scope of ministry like Pioneers it can be frustrating at times for someone looking for direction. Question is what sort of environment do you best thrive in - the definition of what it means to be a Pioneer should be a clue.

pros: Passion for God drives all that Pioneers does.  From that rock solid foundation, they then focus on the most Gospel-needy places on the planet.  Having read earlier reviews, I think it's safe to say that there has been tremendous growth in the deficiencies noted.  There is a growing, robust leadership development program.  Despite the appearance that perhaps the Fletcher family (Ted Fletcher founded Pioneers) runs everything, actually the International Office in Thailand is the highest level of authority and the leadership team is comprised of men and women from several different cultures, reflecting that there are nearly 20 Pioneers bases around the world (Hong Kong, Nigeria, UK, Brazil, etc).
cons: While no one goes into this line of work to get rich, in fact most staff raise their own support, the amount allowed to be raised is sometimes not nearly enough for a family with one income.  There are some practices (particularly around Pioneers USA's IT department) that are cumbersome and actually interfere with completing the mission.  Not sure if things like that are being worked on, but you don't want policies that hinder your mission no matter what your company/organization is.

review_title: Stays true to core values and great for self-directed people
pros: Ability and freedom to dream up plans and implement them. Very prayer- and God-centered. Hold true to core values. Good member care that listens well and seems to be "on my side" even through conflict.
cons:
Leadership has the ability to make unilateral calls that impacts the lives of everyone under them, which can be frustrating if the leader has a directive or commanding style. Sometimes difficult to appeal to higher levels of authority, leaving team members feeling helpless and isolated in conflict.
Lack of procedures and vague direction can be frustrating for people who like more structure.

pros: Passionate people set about doing the greatest possible thing you could do as a vocation.  I am always impressed by the caliber of character and passion of everyone involved in this organization as well as the genuine humility.  Plus, its impossible to find a more fun group of people in work or play.  Somehow they balance zeal to accomplish much with relational warmth.  First rate employer and sending organization for missionaries.
cons: Recruitment numbers were a bit more central than I personally preferred.  Wearing the Kingdom hat or general mobilization not leading to direct recruits eventually got trumped by recruiting numbers making it impossible to carry out those other types of involvement on sure footing.  There is an ongoing tension between these sometimes conflicting interests though its definitely a healthy tension to have to at least some degree.

review_title: Orlando headquarters makes decisions based on lies and false information
pros: I was a paying member of Pioneers for 25 years.  I used to trust the leadership that they would do the right thing and do it the right way.  God peeled that layer back and asked me, "Who can you trust no?"  "Christ, I can trust Christ, He knows the truth and He has not forsaken me."
cons: Keep all of the interest earned on money kept in your accounts.  Give the headquarters interest free loans from money kept in missionary accounts.  Lacks the integrity to investigate the truth when false accusations are made toward a missionary.  More interested in "perception" than the truth.  Give lip service to front line missions, but puts emphasis on a field bureaucracy that takes time from true ministry.

pros: Their overall mission is good and I believe in what this organization is trying to do to help bring the good news of Jesus Christ to unreached people groups.
cons: Overall the organization is a decent place to work depending on the department you work in.  There are a couple of departments I would not recommend because of poor management.  They seem to get away with poor mangenent because of their ethos of grace.

review_title: Field Driven But Misplaced Field Leadership
pros:
Field-driven
Great benefits
Good overall support
Adequate training

I liked how Pioneers is not a top-down organization. Lots of freedom on the field to do ministry the way God may be calling you to.
cons:
Not enough accountability for regional leaders. Had a wonderful regional leader, but was replaced by someone else who did not know how to lead. Tenure on the field seems to take precedent over everyone else. 

A little narrow-minded on their theology. Very conservative.

pros:
CEO is a highly respectable man.

The mission of the company is honorable

Was more ministry minded at one point.

High detuctible benefits are free so no need to purchase insurance because of the federal mandate.

Some very sweet souls still work there.
cons:
Has developed a "Corporate" atmosphere with the addition of their new building.

Conflicts not settled by right or wrong but by how long you've worked there and who you know. Very inconsistent in how employees are treated.

Some of the leadership think they're big time because the organization has grown. They treat lower level staff as commodities instead of people.

Good people have been fired because they became the "fall guy" for poor management.

"Do as I say but not as I do" mentality from management. They expect the employees to live by a bunch of rules that the management doesn't have to.

HR exists not to help employees but to cover Pioneers backside. HR always takes the side of management unless a manager or team leader does something major like sexual harrassment or discrimination because of race.

Now functions like a business or corporation instead of a ministry.

Never liked how they treated the employees on the service side of the operation. In meetings and newsletters they proclaim the importance of reaching all people because God values all people in every culture. Yet, they treat people on the services teams and lower level employees like they are beneath them and undeserving of respect.

review_title: Excellent mission agency that does not do top down management.
pros: Creative, flexible, upg centric, God centric, flat organization which encourages participatory leadership and values, committed reliable leaders with a passion for what they do best.
cons: Lots of rope to newbies leaving some to flounder.  Not much constructive input/ training for their organizational objectives.  Yet this is changing.

pros:
healthy work environment
shared vision to take the gospel to the unreached
servant leadership 
flexibility and concern for employees' unique needs
cons:
uneven compensation and expectations between supported and salaried employees
fast pace of growth can lead to challenging workloads for some

pros: An organization that stays true to its core values from the individual employees through management and right to the CEO.
cons: Weak organizational structure often leads to confusion for employees. Policies are not published well and are very difficult to ascertain.

pros: Great core values (in theory).
cons: Sadly the core values of ethos of grace and servant leadership were not utilized.  Do not join a new team or start a new team, it will not work.  The leadership doesn't know what they are doing (team, area, and regional).  Only consider using PI if you are joining an existing team that has been in place for awhile with many years of experience and know how to back it up.

review_title: Flexible Company on a Great Mission
pros: Pioneers helps you get to where you think God is leading you. They give legitimacy to your fundraising efforts, which is hugely important. They also manage the donations and manage your various funds. The team leaders are committed and compassionate!
cons: You have to fundraise on your own. PI takes 12% of the donations that come into your account. Health insurance is expensive and doesn't cover much.

pros: Pioneers excels at empowering their workers to reach all the dreams God gives them. A very positive, energetic staff and environment. They know their values and they live by them.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros:
Pioneers is on the frontline of missions
Lots of opportunity in a growing nonprofit
cons:
Salaries are usually on the lower end of nonprofit spectrum 
Technology situation is rough, needs investment

pros:
- God-centered work environment
- Rich emphasis on prayer in the work place
- Willingness to be flexible and gracious
cons:
- Lack of clarity of mission
- Benefits package is basic
- Can be stingy

review_title: it depends on what you are looking for
pros: generally nice people who believe in what they do
cons: little opportunity for career growth

pros: Sincere desire to serve God and others. Humility displayed at all levels.
cons: Support raising is not for the faint of heart.

pros: they love work in teams and will folks where they want to work.
cons: raising your own support is tough

pros: Really great place to work.
cons: There are no perfect places to work.

pros:
Great core values.
Creative freedom for employees.
Flexible work hours.
cons:
Nepotism, who knows who is important.
Weak field leadership that in the name of grace rather covers up misconduct than addressing hot issues. Field workers do have very little support from management.
